questions.question: …………………….. you have a car?
questions.description: Use do with you. In the simple present tense, we make questions and negatives with do and does.

questions.question: What ……………………. you doing there?
questions.description: The present continuous form is made with is/am/are + ing. Use are with you.

questions.question: What ……………………. you want?
questions.description: In the simple present tense, we make questions and negatives with do or does.

questions.question: She ……………………. arrived yet.
questions.description: The past participle is used with has/have.

questions.question: It ……………………. stopped raining since yesterday.
questions.description: The past participle is used with has or have.

questions.question: You ……………………. never helped me with anything.
We ………………………. waiting for them.
questions.description: Use is/am/are with the ing form.

questions.question: Why …………………….. you looking at me like that?
What ……………………… you do then?
questions.description: In the simple past we make questions with did.

questions.question: She said that she ……………………… coming.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, the other verbs too should be in the past tense.

questions.question: She ……………………… know who I am.
questions.description: In the simple present, we make questions and negatives with do and does.
